author: Nick Castillo
title: Texas prediction: Sooners, Mayfield too much for Longhorns in Red River Showdown
text:
No. 10 Oklahoma vs Texas
When: 11 a.m. Saturday
Where: Cotton Bowl
Records: No. 10 Oklahoma (4-0, 1-0 Big 12), Texas (1-4, 0-2)
Last meeting: Oklahoma 31, Texas 26 on Oct. 11, 2014
TV: ABC
What's on the line?
The Golden Hat - the Red River Showdown trophy - and pride are on the line when Texas and No. 10 Oklahoma renew their rivalry on Saturday.
The Longhorns enter the showdown with the Sooners looking to rebound from another disappointing blowout loss. Texas lost to No. 2 TCU, 50-7. The Longhorns will look to improve their 1-4 record with a win over Oklahoma. Texas will try to beat the Sooners for the second time in seven years.
Oklahoma comes into the rivalry with an undefeated record. The Sooners defeated West Virginia on Saturday and will try to keep their perfect record intact. Oklahoma has an opportunity to beat Texas for the fifth time in seven years.
When No. 10 Oklahoma has the ball
The Sooners will use their potent passing attack against the Longhorns. Junior quarterback Baker Mayfield has shined thus far in 2015. He's thrown for 1,382 yards and 13 touchdowns. Mayfield averages 345.5 passing yards. He's also been able to use his feet this season. Mayfield has scored four rushing touchdowns.
Oklahoma will try to get its running game going with sophomore running back Samaje Perine. Perine, the Big 12 leading rushing in 2014, has rushed for 328 yards, two touchdowns this season and averages 4.57 yards per carry. The Sooners will also use Mixon in the running game as he's rushed for 136 yards and one touchdown this season.
They'll also use senior wide receiver Sterling Shepard in the passing game. He's caught 20 passes for 321 yards and three touchdowns this season.
When Texas has the ball
The Longhorns will continue to try and utilize redshirt freshman quarterback Jerrod Heard's athleticism. Heard and the offense struggled against TCU and will look to bounce back from their rough performance. Texas will try to use Heard's ability as a dual-threat to overwhelm the favorited Sooners.
Texas will also need to protect Heard against Oklahoma. The Longhorns' missed senior offensive lineman Kent Perkins against the Horned Frogs. They hope to get Perkins back against the Sooners. Texas will try to get a better showing from their offensive line against the Oklahoma.
The Longhorns will try to get their running game going. Sophomore running back D'Onta Foreman has outperformed senior running back Johnathan Gray in 2015. Texas will look to use both rushers against Oklahoma.
The Longhorns will try to get big plays from wide receivers John Burt and Armanti Foreman on Saturday.
Prediction
Texas enters the game reeling from its loss to TCU. Oklahoma is riding a wave of momentum after its win against the Mountaineers.
The Longhorns' will have an opportunity to establish its offense and take advantage of Oklahoma's defense as it hasn't been a strong unit for the Sooners.
Mayfield has had a great year passing with his 345.5 passing yards per game. Texas' defense has given up plays this season and Mayfield can take advantage of a struggling defense. The Longhorns' defense will continue to have troubles in the Cotton Bowl.
While Texas will be in the game early, Oklahoma will be too much for the Longhorns to beat.
Score: Oklahoma 48, Texas 17
